website_summaries.verdict: Formulated with terry cloth and flexible leather to achieve high performance.
pros: Stays dry and protects hands even during extreme play
Minimal motion compromise with its high-tech architecture
cons: You may find the fabric stretches out quickly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Pickleball and find it to be perfect. There's enough build-up in critical parts of the upper hand to provide the protection I was looking for. I bought/looked at 4 other gloves. This is the only glove I found sufficient. It's comfortable. Does not affect my play. When this wears out I'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Wilhelmina C. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Feel good and hold up great.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for about six months and they hold up great. I play racquetball about four hours per week and they still are doing well. I bought a second pair but have not even opened the package.
customer_reviews.author: JAR

customer_reviews.title: The glove feels great...
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this glove. .I really like it, but don't know about durability yet, will have to use it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: cokemanr

customer_reviews.title: Quality stuff
customer_reviews.text: Glove works very well Fits like a glove (ha) and appears to be made well. I've used it three times since I've purchased it and it is holding up well. I wish I would have started using a glove sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Best Glove
customer_reviews.text: Been playing racquetball for 40 years. This is my favorite glove. Durable, comfortable, and excellent grip.
customer_reviews.author: amd29165

customer_reviews.title: Was a good glove but didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur player and I bought this glove with a new racquet so I could have consistent equipment to build my game on. This glove has a great look and feel, but the stitching on the glove broke apart rather quickly. I had this glove for a month, using it about 2-3 times per week, and the central stitching on the palm has already come undone, exposing my hand underneath. The glove is essentially ruined; I would have to restitch the whole seam to fix it. Definitely not worth the money for a product that has such a short life.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit by following their instructions. Well made, has help up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: netwrkgod

customer_reviews.title: Good glove
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these gloves in the last couple of years. I use them for squash, as I sweat a lot and need a good grip on the racquet. Both have provided a nice stick and are breathable, however, the first one had some issues of stitching coming undone after a few months of play. Also, be careful about washing them, as the first one turned rock hard after I gave it a good scrub in the sink. Otherwise, this is a well designed glove, light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jibberz

customer_reviews.title: okay product... not great.
customer_reviews.text: works well for 2 weeks... about 20 sets in and glove started to fall apart.... cracked and torn near the base. thrown out !
customer_reviews.author: Tj-Cool

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it felt a bit tight, I thought I should have ordered an L instead on an M. Though, after a couple of games it was fine. It's very comfortable. Will definitely get more.
customer_reviews.author: akmal_muqeeth

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting glove
customer_reviews.text: Great long lasting glove. Most gloves are good for one game or less, these I play 2-3 before needing to change. My new standard.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional, Glove of choice. I wouldn't buy anything ...
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional, Glove of choice. I wouldn't buy anything else. I think it shrinks a little after it gets [sweaty] wet and dries.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, It is not very sticky. I do like the styling and the design is nice. However, the bottom line is the grip just isnt up to standard.
customer_reviews.author: rmchl

customer_reviews.title: Gripping
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the cost. Works well and fits good
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Glove
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this glove for the past 2 months and it is still in decent condition. Most gloves only last me 1 month or so. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: By far the better of the bunch
customer_reviews.text: The product(s) arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped without issue, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials. Description, photograph, website presentation, and what arrived are the same-size, shape, color, and it matched my expectations. Well fitting, good performance, shock absorption is superior to most of the Wal-Mart type gloves I've used in the past, and stylish. I enjoyed it's feel, comfort, and it's well ventilated so that moisture doesn't soak into the glove and become uncomfortable. Plus, it looks pretty darn cool!
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Kind expensive and have had gloves with better grip for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Enoch

customer_reviews.title: Not a good pickleball glvoe
customer_reviews.text: The glove fit great and looks great but fell apart playing pickleball after 30 games. It doesn't like sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, but falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Within the first day of use the threading on the fingers is fraying severely and falling apart. I will post a pic soon.
customer_reviews.author: joel fleet

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but will not last
customer_reviews.text: Loose thread starts coming out apart, glove does not last and retains sweat stains
customer_reviews.author: Javier A. Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, well made glove. I highly recommend to any racquetball player who's looking for a top notch glove.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Parr

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: it's better than Wilson gloves. try this one you will love it for sure. good feel with more control to handle your racket perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: racquet glove
customer_reviews.text: This helped improve my game a lot. I haven't tried others, but have really like this one so far. The only thing that I wasn't a fan of, is the discoloration from the black handle of the racquet wearing onto the white part of the glove
customer_reviews.author: wit wiki

customer_reviews.title: Racquetball glove for tennis
customer_reviews.text: Use them for tennis and they work well, especially when weather is hot and hands are really wet from sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Loran D. Loy

customer_reviews.title: Good glove
customer_reviews.text: Glove was great for handball. Should of got the pair
customer_reviews.author: AmazSash

customer_reviews.title: A high quality glove
customer_reviews.text: Great glove. It feels soft and sticky and looks good to boot. I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Racquetball Glove
customer_reviews.text: I must say i was skeptical about buying this product. I am a current ProKennex racquetball player and only use their equipment to include gloves and shoes. I was impressed with the way the glove handled all the prespiration and torture i put it through just on the first day of using it. I would definitely recommend this product to other racquetball players.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Glove is good but the wrist band is very tight
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most well constructed gloves I've played with. I'm tough on them and these are holding up better than most.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: The racquetball glove to end all glove discussions
customer_reviews.text: . I've played the game for over 20 years and this is by far the best glove I've ever tried. I own 5 of them. Stop wasting your time and money and get one. You'll never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Alberto Perez

customer_reviews.title: This glove has already torn in multiple places
customer_reviews.text: its not even 6 weeks of sporadic use maybe a total of 12 times and this glove has already torn in multiple places - i had high hopes for this but now very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tushar

customer_reviews.title: l enjoy this racket, had one I n the past only thing this racket has flaw after a couple of plays it might break, mines had this
customer_reviews.text: It looked nice fit well had a nice grip, help with my game and l would recommend this item to other players
customer_reviews.author: Linda culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Not a very durable glove to play with.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove, giving it a try. I play about 3 times a week outdoors, with florida having the weather and climate for outdoor. At first it was a good fitting glove. But after a while with the playing, of which I play pretty decent and fast pace kind of game, it wore down and 3 nights ago, it tore on the thumb and 2nd finger. No wonder they have a monthly subscription on this glove. This is a very disposable glove. My advice stick to the big names like head, wilson, as I have both of those and they are still in good condition after 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Drewster

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and control.  Nice protective features.
customer_reviews.text: This is double the price I normally pay for racquetball glove. However, it is well-made and contains many features that the inexpensive model does not offer. The securing strap is higher on the wrist area instead of the common over the back of the hand Velcro latch. The padded cushions on the the back of fingers protects them from hitting ground directly when diving for shots. The leather material seems thicker and looks durable.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Grip, and Padded Protection for Racquetball
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this racquetball glove a few times a week for almost a month now. It's a good replacement for my old one. I got it on recommendation from a friend who play s a ton of racquetball and has used this glove for a few years. In particular th epadding on the ring and little finger and back of the hand add a bit of protection when swinging near the wall. The glove material grips the racquet nicely even when wet (I sweat a ton). They fit very comfortably. I'm glad my friend recommended this; I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob and Kiki HantlaTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Great glove, great price.  Very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. In fact, when I first used this glove I liked it so much, I purchased 6 of them and threw out all my old gloves. I have big hands but chose the Large instead of XL. It is tight when I first put it on but once it warms up and/or gets sweaty, it loosens up and fits perfect. They are also very durable. While other gloves tear in the palm, these are hanging tough.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Large size is too small.
customer_reviews.text: Glove is well made, but I believe the sizes run small. I received Large glove (that's what I ordered). It fits my fairly average-sized band very tightly. After 15-20 minutes, my hand gets numb. When I reorder, I will request one size larger than I would normally order.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit-buy up one size
customer_reviews.text: Quality product- I had been using half tennis gloves which wore out much quicker. A tennis friend recommended the Bionic glove. Playing four times a week this summer it lasted 2.5 months. It is hot but helps the gripping. If you can buy for $20 or less, get two, so you can alternate.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Good Glove
customer_reviews.text: The price has been slowly going up but it's still one of my favorite gloves. I have big hands and this one fits great. I have bought 3 of them so far. When one gets worn out I buy another one because they are relatively inexpensive compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Guadz

customer_reviews.title: Not the best glove....
customer_reviews.text: I've been a higher level player for decades and worn MANY gloves during that time. I received this glove from Amazon on February 1st,2014.This glove quickly stretched and within weeks was no longer a snug fit. As if that weren't bad enough,the glove has these little breather holes on the fingers on the inside of the glove that are covered on the inside with a nylon fabric piece stitched in place. Those stitches are coming loose along with the fabric patches only a month after I started using the glove. Somebody took some shortcuts here to save costs on a sophisticated design. Do not buy this glove.
customer_reviews.author: Caymus77

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My favorite racquetball glove on the market. The XXL size is perfect for larger wider hands. If you play frequently, they wear out rather quickly but the comfort and price is worth it. Nice because they are washable too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs large and not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a snug Xlg. This one us running large for me and is a little loose. In addition I have some fraying and one of the little holes on the fingers has come unstitched after maybe 3 hours of play. . I like the way the strap tightens and its comfy but still not sure i will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Logan H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Glove
customer_reviews.text: High quality product that provides excellent grip as well as superior ventilation. The padded sections on the outside of the glove also makes taking close wall shots a lot easier, w/o having to worry about damaging your hand.
customer_reviews.author: XKR

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite racquetball gloves. Have 3 of them now. Fyi they are a bit thick if you don't like that. Also I have to change them out every other game because of sweat but I sweat allot.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Curson

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: I use this glove when playing pickle ball, it is very comfortable, and has padding in all the right places. I’ve had it for three months, it hasn’t worn in any place at all! I play pickle ball about every other day, I would highly recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: Jim Howard

customer_reviews.title: Solid Grip, Last 1yr+
customer_reviews.text: I am an intermediate player, non competitive, 5' 7", right handed and use a light racket three times a week. Tried three glove brands and this is the only one that had solid grip such that the racket didnt move and was comfortable. It last a year before starting to wear off. Still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ford Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Good fitting glove
customer_reviews.text: This glove fits tight and feels comfortable, has a little thicker Hyde with small cutouts that create thicker and thinner areas to prevent slipping. Has become my favorite glove.
customer_reviews.author: grclark50

customer_reviews.title: A Repeat Customer.
customer_reviews.text: These are racquetball gloves. In my opinion, they are well constructed, durable, and they look bad-ass. The largest size is XXL, which barely fits. No complaints; I'm glad that they do fit, though I have to struggle to get them on. Another brand of XXL, fit like an XL. It would be great if they would make a XXXL; that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Powell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic glove - wish the palm wasn't white
customer_reviews.text: Really a fantastic glove - great fit and grip while being durable with an a easy-to-tighten wrist. The only drawback is that the palm is white, so it looked filthy after the first use and has only gotten worse. Highly recommended nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Shane A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove for Raquetball
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats playing without a glove, but I needed a glove to keep the racquet in my hand. Plains and Simple After playing for about 45 minutes my hand would be very sweaty, so I needed a glove to try to eliminate this problem, I needed a glove that would breathe and be comfortable, also allowing my hand to stay dry and cool. This glove allows me to play for a good 1.5 hours, before starting to get wet on the inside. All and all this glove works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Decent, a little heavy, but I was looking for durable after playing through a Head glove in about eight months. Fit seems a little loose, I'd by a size smaller next time.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glove for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best glove you'll ever wear during play. I have purchased many gloves thru the years but in the last few have landed on this one. Holds up well after2-3 hours of highly competitive matches. I am a B+ skill level player and I have had no issues over the years with the Bionic!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Adds a few points to your game.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. I have big hands and the large is perfect. Game changer that is affordable!
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great glove, but don't get it wet
customer_reviews.text: I use this for racquetball and it's served quite well. It takes a little bit for the leather to be broken in, but once it does, its smooth and supple. I would be careful about getting it wet (like when you drink a water bottle) as it degrades the glove. Eventually, it will need replacing, but so far, after about 50 uses, it hasn't broken or ripped, which is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: GREAT glove!
customer_reviews.text: It's so soft even after a long day of pickleball, the sweat glove drys, and is easy to put back on the next day. Worth the money:)
customer_reviews.author: KCFH22

customer_reviews.title: Good glove.
customer_reviews.text: This glove seems to hold up well. I use it to play pickleball.
customer_reviews.author: WVfan

customer_reviews.title: Good. Happy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this glove. Great quality and design. And it fits my big hand.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: You're better off with the HEAD Web glove for $12
customer_reviews.text: Update: In less than two months, with roughly two games played per week, this glove has ripped a giant hole in the palm, rendering it unusable. Don't waste your money. Ordered on 6/22. By 7/19, the pinky had ripped a sizable hole on the outside. I played maybe 10 games at most with it? You're better off with the HEAD Web glove for $12.
customer_reviews.author: Travis A.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My hand sweats a lot, and after using for a week, the gloves let it though and I get absolutely no grip while playing. I don’t recommend it if your palms sweat a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Raghu

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit/Stretches too much.
customer_reviews.text: Although the glove is a large, my hand can barely fit in through the wrist portion of the glove. Once in, the glove feels loose from the start. After a few minutes of use, it becomes clownishly oversized; a condition which renders the glove less than useless as the racquet begins to slip and rotate in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Cubelodyte

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic glove
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this glove and find it to be fantastic. It is far superior to my old glove that I got from the local store (and cheaper to boot). It's a snug fit, which I want in a racquetball glove. It is cushioned in all the right places. My racket doesn't slip in my hands and I have a black racket but none of the color has worn off. It's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: James Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my third glove, with my two others being the run of the mil (~$20) Ekelton gloves. These are vastly superior. I cannot speak to their long term durability as I got them about 2 weeks ago, but they are light, breathable, very comfortable, don't get hard with sweat, and keep my racket firmly in my hand. If you're on the fence, jump and you wont be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Dantes

customer_reviews.title: Sweet fit
customer_reviews.text: Great fit right out of the box. This has to be the most comfortable glove out there. The only complaint I have, is after four months the elastic wrist ripped from the glove when I was putting it on.
customer_reviews.author: Christa L Rice

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer than any other
customer_reviews.text: This glove lasts 3 times longer than any other that I have tried. It’s the only one I will buy now.
customer_reviews.author: monica white

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I use this glove for tennis since it seems Bionic doesn't make the glove for tennis any longer. I love this glove. It keeps my (right) tennis hand blister and perspiration-free in the summer and also keeps hand warm in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: California Guy

customer_reviews.title: This is my new go-to RB glove.  Absolutely better than all others I've used.  Just enough shock absorption without the loss of f
customer_reviews.text: This is my new go-to RB glove. Absolutely better than all others I've used. Just enough shock absorption without the loss of feel.
customer_reviews.author: Herr_Blucher

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Im really happy with the way this glove fits and fell.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Better than most gloves I have used. Very comfortable and it does not shrivel up when drying out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Black

customer_reviews.title: One of the few 2XL gloves out there
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice glove for a guy with big hands. Most racquetball gloves don't come in 2XL so my options are pretty limited. The glove almost seems like a tight end football glove with all the padding on the back of the hand, but either way it works well.
customer_reviews.author: 8383T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit. Eliminated my need for a rosin bag. Has held up for several games now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Velcro is a little short. Quality is very good.
customer_reviews.text: After 16 month of use I've finally worn it out.
customer_reviews.author: Brent S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid glove, great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The glove has a terrific fit, and the elastic wrist wrap is tops bar none. It also does a great job of keeping my hand dry. I can easily wear this glove for three games before needing a dry one. With others I would have to change between every game. Cons: The palm leather is kinda thin, and I'm worried that it's not going to last. Bottom line: If they went on sale I would consider buying again. Otherwise I going to stick with Ektelon or Python gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Kromhout

customer_reviews.title: Great product that I should have bought long ago
customer_reviews.text: This glove is awesome! The grip is very stable even when the glove is slightly moist. It handles moisture better than any racquetball glove that I have bought from store shelves. It saves me time and money because I use leather cleaner after playing my games and in the past I had to clean 3 or 4 gloves. Now I just have to clean one glove after playing. Like other reviewers said, make sure that you use the measurement guide. The one size above your usual size is a good thumb rule to go by.
customer_reviews.author: jwafer

customer_reviews.title: Non slip grip
customer_reviews.text: I use this glove for tennis. The humidity here in Florida takes it’s toll on the durability of the glove. If used for racquetball I’m sure it would hold up much. That being said, the glove provides a firm grip on the racquet regardless of the heat and humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Tennis enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: They are expensive than other gloves I pay for quality and I did not get that
customer_reviews.text: I used to like them But the last order I got the first day I used the stitching came Undone on the fingers .Knowing that may happen after 30 days not the second time I used it disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Damon Small

customer_reviews.title: I really love these gloves.  I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: I really love these gloves. I will buy them again. I love the padding on the back of the glove but I also love the padding in the fingers. However, it is not too much to make feel too thick. It is just the right amount of padding.
customer_reviews.author: billg13

customer_reviews.title: Order one size larger than you normally wear
customer_reviews.text: These fit very snug and though all my other gloves are large i had to order an extra large to get the proper fit. I have used it three-four days per week for several months and it is still holding up fine with limited wear on the palm and no stretching or tearing at the seams.
customer_reviews.author: aeljas

customer_reviews.title: Okay, not great
customer_reviews.text: Okay glove. DIdn't feel like I had great grip during the game. I also purchased the Python glove at the same time and find I'm playing with that one much more.
customer_reviews.author: oregonrunningguy

customer_reviews.title: Best glove I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I normally need to change gloves after every game b/c I sweat through them. This glove is amazingly absorbent. I can play 3 games and not sweat through it. It is very expensive, but well worth it since I'll need fewer gloves overall. Hopefully it lasts long... I've only used it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: No glove lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I play two to five times a week. Have done for years. I have gone through a lot of gloves. I normally go through a glove in four to six weeks. My Bionic glove had lasted six months. Some of the others, and they weren't cheap (Head etc.) wouldn't even last a week, before a hole would appear in the palm. I have just ordered this glove for the second time.
customer_reviews.author: Gloatbridge

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart quickly.....don’t buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second glove, the first one worked out ok, it lasted about 3 months of daily use. The second one fell apart after three games. Very disappointed and will have to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lexxa

customer_reviews.title: The Bionic Glove
customer_reviews.text: Decent glove, won't be my first choice. Begins to slip after two medium paced games. Glove is under sized, make sure you order a size larger. I would say it's worth about $12 rather than the 16 -20 you normally see. Wrist strap is good.
customer_reviews.author: NVR4MONEY

customer_reviews.title: OK for causal players, perhaps, not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this glove. It was great the first few uses but it quickly stretched out and lost its form and does not provide the grip that I would have expected at this price. I buy more expensive gloves for the no slip factor and moisture is somewhat problematic for me. Moisture was managed well with the glove, it was not that which caused the problem, it is the thinness of the leather and that it stretched out so very quickly. I won't buy this one again but it could be OK for players that don't play really hard.
customer_reviews.author: D Rees

customer_reviews.title: Great glove.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. They last a long time. Much longer than the ektelon's I was wearing before. Bought this in conjunction Tacki-Mac Serrated MT Grip and its a great combo. Seems to run true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in the Big O

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I've found yet
customer_reviews.text: I play 2-3 times/week, men's A level. These gloves are better all around than any other glove I've used over the years. They last longer, the Pinky padding and stitching holds up better, and wrist strap holds more securely.
customer_reviews.author: Andygator

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort but tore up to fast
customer_reviews.text: Tore up way to fast. Overall comfort and feel was great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More like a baseball glove.
customer_reviews.text: Giving this glove 2 stars. There is no benefit for this glove in racquetball. It doesn’t have enough grip and continues to slide on the handle. It is more like a baseball glove.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Snug fit. Buying one for the left hand.
customer_reviews.author: frank frantz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: This glove look very nice, feel very nice and it definitely protects your hand. I also don't feel like I sweat a lot when I have it on compared to other gloves I owned in the past.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Best out there
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 10-12 other gloves and this is by far the best glove out there. Amazing grip and keeps my hand dry throughout the game. The padding on the top side does nothing for me. I have owned two of these over the last 2 years and will continue to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Naustdal

customer_reviews.title: Average quality but decent grip. I only played with ...
customer_reviews.text: Average quality but decent grip. I only played with it for couple of weeks and I had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: It fits snugly and feels good during play
customer_reviews.text: This glove has served me well for about 9 mos. now. It fits snugly and feels good during play.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Gloves came apart at a seam after about 48 hours of use over 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pair of these gloves. Liked the gloves but they each came apart at a seam after about 48 hours of use over 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove for the first two months
customer_reviews.text: This glove was awesome for the first two months. After that the leather on the palm to the wrist started to get hard from the sweat and eventually tore a hole the size of a nickel.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the glove, but after a few wearings it smells really bad. Washing helps some.
customer_reviews.author: cyndi reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Glove fits great. I've been playing with this brand for 9 ...
customer_reviews.text: Glove fits great. I've been playing with this brand for 9 years and I'm always satisfied. The shipping was a huge plus!! I received it very quickly and I have an APO address which usually complicates shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Page

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Glove works fine, although once you're playing it doesn't seem any different from my cheaper RQB gloves. Overall, I'll probably buy another one or two.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: XX-Large Fit Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have very long fingers. I think if I had to wear a numbered sized, they would be 15. These XX-Large gloves fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Quite happy with this glove
customer_reviews.text: Very nice glove, tight and snug where it needs to be, and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great glove, but not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I play about 6 hours a week nowdays. The glove grips even after playing for a couple of hours. Used several other gloves, but I keep coming back to this always. Only problem is that it does not seem to be made of high quality material. A glove hardly lasts a month for me. It always tears around the stitches by the palm.
customer_reviews.author: KA

product_meta.title: Bionic Men's Right Hand Racquetball Glove, Medium
product_meta.description: The Racquetball Gloves are specifically designed to maximize your game. The lightweight breathable material will help your hands stay cool and comfortable.
feature_bullets: Anatomical pads system evens out the surface of your hands to promote a lighter, more secure grip for enhanced racquet control.
Eleven terry cloth mini-towels inside the glove absorb moisture to help keep your hands cool and dry.
Top-grade sheepskin leather helps prevent slippage, while holding up to the wear and tear of heavy, frequent play.
Form-fitting terry cloth wristband absorbs sweat and provides added wrist support.
